	Home » News » NBA stars joke about Kylian Mbappe reported salary offer
NBA stars joke about Kylian Mbappe reported salary offer
		
			Last updated on 25 Jul 2023 by Hammad Wasim		

	


	



	
This week’s biggest topic in sports is Kylian Mbappe, whose transfer story took an unexpected turn on Monday. On Monday, word of the offer circulated over social media, attracting the interest of the NBA top players.



Giannis Antetokounmpo, a standout with the Milwaukee Bucks, shared a selfie on Twitter with the message:



“Al Hilal you can take me. I look like Kylian Mbappe.”



Al Hilal you can take me. I look like Kylian Mbappe  pic.twitter.com/VH0syez3VX
— Giannis Antetokounmpo (@Giannis_An34) July 24, 2023 


According to reports, Saudi Arabian club Al Hilal offered to break the world record transfer fee and pay $332 million (€300 million) for the striker because his situation at Paris-Saint-Germain (PSG) is now at an impasse.



A stunning $775 million wage package is reportedly included in the planned deal for the 24-year-old Mbappé.



Mbappé responded to the article with 13 weeping laughing emojis, despite the fact that he hasn’t yet spoken out about the new offer or the transfer rumours that have been swirling around him. Antetokounmpo, a two-time NBA MVP, wasn’t the only NBA player shocked by the staggering amount of money involved.



Basketball legend LeBron James also posted a joke on Twitter, along with a video of Forest Gump running.



“Me headed to Saudi when they call @RichPaul4 & @mavcarter for that 1 year deal!”



NBA Stars React to Kylian Mbappe Reported $776 Million Offer from Al Hilal



James overtook Kevin Durant as the highest-paid player in NBA history in 2022 after agreeing to a new contract with the Los Angeles Lakers that increased his guaranteed lifetime earnings to $532 million.



Mbappé reportedly notified PSG in June that he would not be activating his third-year option, leaving the club with the choice of selling their star player this summer or letting him leave for free in 2024.
It pales in comparison to what Mbappé would purportedly make from one season at Al Hilal.



Damian Lillard, a guard for the Portland Trail Blazers, intervened and tweeted: “1 year 776mm? Wtf lol ...”  



Golden State Warriors forward Draymond Green also chimed in on twitter: “They got basketball leagues too right? Don’t the ink on my contract has dried up yet.”



Suggested Read: Real Madrid will wait late August to launch bid for Kylian Mbappe






	
		
			Hammad Wasim

<header class="entry-header my-3">
	<p id="breadcrumbs"><span><span><a href="https://www.sportinglad.com/" target="_blank">Home</a></span> » <span><a href="https://www.sportinglad.com/news/" target="_blank">News</a></span> » <span class="breadcrumb_last" aria-current="page">NBA stars joke about Kylian Mbappe reported salary offer</span></span></p>
<h1 class="entry-title my-2 ">NBA stars joke about Kylian Mbappe reported salary offer</h1>
		<div class="entry-meta text-capitalize">
			<span class="posted-on"><time class="entry-date updated" datetime="2023-07-25T11:07:14+00:00">Last updated on 25 Jul 2023</time></span><span class="byline"> by <span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://www.sportinglad.com/author/hammad-wasim/" target="_blank">Hammad Wasim</a></span></span>		</div>

	</header>

<div class="featured-image mb-3 rounded overflow-hidden">
	<img width="821" height="500" src="data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAzUAAAH0AQAAAAAsvD55AAAAAnRSTlMAAHaTzTgAAABJSURBVHja7cExAQAAAMKg9U9tDQ+gAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAB4MssgAAF8gc4uAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC" class="attachment-full size-full img-fluid img-pls lazyload" alt="nba-stars-joke-about-kylian-mbappe-reported-salary-offer" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" data-src="https://www.sportinglad.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/ezgif.com-gif-maker-5-2.webp" data-srcset="https://www.sportinglad.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/ezgif.com-gif-maker-5-2.webp 821w, https://www.sportinglad.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/ezgif.com-gif-maker-5-2-300x183.webp 300w, https://www.sportinglad.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/ezgif.com-gif-maker-5-2-768x468.webp 768w" data-sizes="auto" data-eio-rwidth="821" data-eio-rheight="500"><noscript><img width="821" height="500" src="https://sandbox.copyleaks.com/?url=https://www.sportinglad.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/ezgif.com-gif-maker-5-2.webp" class="attachment-full size-full img-fluid img-pls" alt="nba-stars-joke-about-kylian-mbappe-reported-salary-offer" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" srcset="https://sandbox.copyleaks.com/?url=https://www.sportinglad.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/ezgif.com-gif-maker-5-2.webp 821w, https://sandbox.copyleaks.com/?url= https://www.sportinglad.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/ezgif.com-gif-maker-5-2-300x183.webp 300w, https://sandbox.copyleaks.com/?url= https://www.sportinglad.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/ezgif.com-gif-maker-5-2-768x468.webp 768w" sizes="(max-width: 821px) 100vw, 821px" data-eio="l"></noscript></div>


<div class="entry-content">
	
<p>This week’s biggest topic in sports is <strong><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Kylian Mbappe</a></strong>, whose transfer story took an unexpected turn on Monday. On Monday, word of the offer circulated over social media, attracting the interest of the <strong><a href="https://www.nba.com/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">NBA </a></strong>top players.</p>



<p><strong><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Giannis_Antetokounmpo" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Giannis Antetokounmpo</a></strong>, a standout with the Milwaukee Bucks, shared a selfie on Twitter with the message:</p>



<p><strong><em>“Al Hilal you can take me. I look like Kylian Mbappe.”</em></strong></p>



<blockquote class="twitter-tweet"><p lang="en" dir="ltr">Al Hilal you can take me. I look like Kylian Mbappe  <a href="https://t.co/VH0syez3VX" target="_blank">pic.twitter.com/VH0syez3VX</a></p>
— Giannis Antetokounmpo (@Giannis_An34) <a href="https://twitter.com/Giannis_An34/status/1683549442287255552?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw" target="_blank">July 24, 2023</a></blockquote> 


<p>According to reports, Saudi Arabian club Al Hilal offered to break the world record transfer fee and pay $332 million (€300 million) for the striker because his situation at <strong><a href="https://en.psg.fr/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Paris-Saint-Germain </a></strong>(PSG) is now at an impasse.</p>



<p>A stunning $775 million wage package is reportedly included in the planned deal for the 24-year-old Mbappé.</p>



<p>Mbappé responded to the article with 13 weeping laughing emojis, despite the fact that he hasn’t yet spoken out about the new offer or the transfer rumours that have been swirling around him. Antetokounmpo, a two-time NBA MVP, wasn’t the only NBA player shocked by the staggering amount of money involved.</p>



<p>Basketball legend <strong><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LeBron_James" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">LeBron </a></strong>James also posted a joke on Twitter, along with a video of Forest Gump running.</p>



<p><em><strong>“Me headed to Saudi when they call @RichPaul4 & @mavcarter for that 1 year deal!”</strong></em></p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading"><strong>NBA Stars React to Kylian Mbappe Reported $776 Million Offer from Al Hilal</strong></h2>



<p>James overtook <strong><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kevin_Durant" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Kevin Durant</a></strong> as the highest-paid player in NBA history in 2022 after agreeing to a new contract with the Los Angeles Lakers that increased his guaranteed lifetime earnings to $532 million.</p>



<p>Mbappé reportedly notified PSG in June that he would not be activating his third-year option, leaving the club with the choice of selling their star player this summer or letting him leave for free in 2024.<br>
It pales in comparison to what Mbappé would purportedly make from one season at Al Hilal.</p>



<p><strong><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Damian_Lillard" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Damian Lillard</a></strong>, a guard for the Portland Trail Blazers, intervened and tweeted: <strong><em>“1 year 776mm? Wtf lol ...” </em></strong> </p>



<p><strong><a href="https://www.nba.com/warriors" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Golden State Warriors</a></strong> forward <strong><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Draymond_Green" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Draymond Green </a></strong>also chimed in on twitter: “<strong><em>They got basketball leagues too right? Don’t the ink on my contract has dried up yet.”</em></strong></p>



<p><strong>Suggested Read:</strong> <strong><em><a href="https://www.sportinglad.com/news/real-madrid-will-wait-late-august-to-launch-bid-for-kylian-mbappe/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Real Madrid will wait late August to launch bid for Kylian Mbappe</a></em></strong></p>

</div>
